title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.11-13 | 26-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chaksharun Miritam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasali Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
In this session we will be discussing from the eleventh, twelfth and thirteenth verses
of the thirteenth chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This chapter is entitled Dhritarashtra Quits Home.
The eleventh verse Apinaha Suhrudastata
Bandhava Krishna Devataha Drishta Shrutava Yadavaha
Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya
Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya
Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya
Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya
Svapuriyam Sukhamasya Svapuriyam Sukhamasya
This is an inquiry made by Yudhishthira to Vidura.
The meaning of this verse is,
My uncle you must have visited Dwaraka.
In that holy place are our friends and well-wishers,
the descendants of Yadu who were always wrapped in the service of the Lord,
Sri Krishna.
You might have seen them or heard about them,
are they all living happily in their abodes so this was the inquiry by yudhishthira
so in the purpose points out the particular word krishna devata
the particular word krishna devata that is those who are always wrapped in the service of lord
krishna is significant the yadavas and the pandavas were always wrapped in the thought
of the lord krishna and his different transcendental activities were all pure devotees of
the lord like vidura not only vidura was a pure devotee even the yadavas and pandavas even while
staying in a palace or staying at home
they were always wrapped in the thought of lord krishna and his different transcendental activities
and this way they are also counted among pure devotees of the lord vidura left home in order
to devote himself completely to the service of the lord but the pandavas and the yadavas
were always wrapped in the thought of
lord krishna thus there is no difference in their pure devotional qualities
either remaining at home or leaving home
the real qualification of a pure devotee is to become wrapped in the thought of krishna favorably
this is very important to continuously absorb oneself in thinking of krishna favorably
that is what is the meaning of favorably becoming absorbed in the thought of krishna
knowing well that lord krishna is the absolute personality of godhead
not that krishna is an ordinary person or krishna is an enemy
or krishna is a like the example given here by srila prabhupada
and other demons like them were also always wrapped in thought of lord krishna
but they were absorbed in a different way namely unfavorably
so favorably being absorbed in thought of krishna is called
krishna consciousness
so favorably being absorbed in thought of krishna is called
krishna consciousness
unfavorably always thinking of krishna like kamsa
that is not krishna consciousness
now these demons they were absorbed in thought of krishna unfavorably
or thinking him to be a powerful man only
see demons they don't recognize krishna in their thoughts
they don't recognize krishna in their thoughts
they don't recognize krishna in their thoughts
Krishna to be the Supreme Personality of Godhead. They don't want to accept or they
think that they can compete with Krishna. This is a very very big mistake.
Therefore Kamsa and Shishupala are not on the same level as pure devotees like
Vidura, the Pandavas and the Yadavas.
Simply by thinking of Krishna always anyone can get salvation but to revive
our dormant devotion to Krishna and to be transferred to his personal abode as
his associate and engage in loving service is possible
only by the divine grace of Lord Krishna.
This is only for those who are absorbed in thinking of Krishna favorably, not unfavorably.
Therefore to think of Krishna in Krishna consciousness.
It is described in the Bhagavad Gita that
always thinking of Krishna in loving devotion in thought of Krishna in loving
devotion that is actually favorable and that is that immediately qualifies one
to actually be transferred to the spiritual world in personal association
of Krishna.
Maharaja Yudhishthira was also always wrapped in the thought of Lord Krishna and his associates in
Dwaraka. Otherwise he could not have asked all about them from Vidura. Maharaja Yudhishthira was
therefore on the same level of devotion as Vidura although engaged in the state affairs of the
kingdom of the world. This is an instruction for us that we may not be traveling to Holy
places, may not be living in a temple but even living at home if we are able to absorb our mind
in Krishna consciousness through chanting Hare Krishna as far as possible and gradually
progressing to come to the stage of constantly thinking of Krishna in so many different ways.
Maharaja Yudhishthira was also always wrapped in the thought of Lord Krishna in so many different ways.
The art of constantly thinking of Krishna has to be learnt from Srila Prabhupad by
following his instructions by reading his books, by associating with his
devotees, by engaging in devotional service, in varieties of ways recommended
in the scriptures we can be always thinking of Krishna and become attracted
to Krishna and Krishna consciousness.
promote ourselves to the kingdom of krishna in the spiritual world at any time we can
do that we can immediately transfer ourselves to the spiritual world the twelfth verse
the meaning of this verse is thus being questioned by maharaj yudhishthira
mahatma vidura gradually described everything he had personally experienced except the news of the
annihilation of the yadu dynasty vidura told everything except that the yadu dynasty was
completely annihilated that he did not tell why in the 13th verse that is explained why
so 13th verse
the meaning of this 13th verse says compassionate mahatma vidura
could not stand to see the pandavas distressed at any time therefore he did not disclose this
unpalatable and unbearable incident because
calamities come of their own accord
so in this 13th verse it's explained that vidura did not disclose this unpalatable and unbearable
incident of the annihilation of the yadu dynasty to the pandavas now srita prabhupada says in the
purport according to niti shastra civic laws one should not speak an unpalatable truth to cause
distress to others the niti shastra says
satyam bhruyat priyam bhruyat na bhruyat satyam apriyam
apriyam is unpalatable even though it may be the truth
apriyam satyam unpalatable truth one should not speak because that will cause distress to others
see how refined is
vedic culture that you must speak the truth but only that which is palatable
why why is it like this because distress comes upon us in its own way
by the laws of nature see nobody can prevent natural calamities
they come of their own accord
just like the example
is given of a forest fire nobody goes to the forest to set fire to the trees
but when there is sometimes in blazing summer heat when there is a
wind blowing and there is friction between two dry bamboo pieces and there is a spark that spark can
ignite a fire in the dry bamboo in the blazing sun and that fire
will spread throughout the forest a dense forest filled with dry bamboo
plants it can spread very quickly and the fire will even aid the spreading of the fire and a big
portion of the forest can be entirely echeloned by this fire to collect out fire wherever they may be
forest can be entirely burnt away by the forest fire and great destruction can happen
now this is not due to somebody going and setting fire to the dry bamboo no it happens of its own
accord by arrangement of providence therefore it is said here distress comes upon us in its own way
by the laws of nature so one should not aggravate it by propaganda there is no need to speak of
unpalatable truths if we want to
not cause distress for people who are already distressed by natural calamities
so this is the
so one should not aggravate the distress by propaganda
further
for a compassionate soul like vidura especially in his dealings with the beloved pandavas
it was almost impossible to disclose an unpalatable piece of news like the annihilation
of the yadu dynasty the pandavas and the yadavas they were very closely related
both by family ties and because both were devotees of pure devotees of krishna so they always
discussed about krishna
in absorbed in thought of krishna as you said in the previous verse so therefore
vidura did not
disclose this news of the annihilation yadu dynasty purposely refrained from it and except
that he told everything else about his travels to the pandavas i'll stop here thank you very much
hari krishna
